2. Clean the machine thoroughly.
3. Re-lubricate all points after cleaning for conservation.
4. Avoid using high-pressure cleaners near seals or breathers to prevent dirt and moisture entry.
5. Do not set up electrical components to avoid water-induced failures.
6. Apply preservative grease to white parts like piston rods of hydraulic cylinders.
7. Use non-hardening grease on cylinder oil seals to prevent damage.

These steps ensure the machine is ready for work after winter storage.
